DOCNAME: CASE OF MERYEM ÇELİK AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Six month period);Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Guido Raimondi;Nebojša Vučinić;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals and live in the NORP district of PERSON .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL . According to the ORG submissions , on DATE military and gendarmerie forces arrived in GPE . The inhabitants of the hamlet were told by members of the security forces to gather at the helicopter landing pad , which was in the main square . The men of the village were stripped naked and beaten . CARDINAL of the applicants , PERSON and PERSON , who were pregnant at the time of the events , were also beaten when they protested against the security forces’ conduct and both eventually suffered miscarriages . Furthermore , PERSON was killed by a non - commissioned gendarmerie officer , a certain PERSON , when he did not obey the order to gather in the main square .

CARDINAL . The security forces set fire to the houses in the hamlet . Subsequently , ORG , ORG , Aşur Seçkin , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON were put in military vehicles by the soldiers to be taken to the military base . On the way to the base , the soldiers stopped CARDINAL cars in which CARDINAL villagers were travelling . The soldiers let the CARDINAL children in the cars go , but arrested PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and ORG . The soldiers then set fire to the ORG cars .

CARDINAL . The applicants and other villagers were forced to leave ORG and GPE by the security forces . They then crossed the border into GPE . In that respect , according to a document dated DATE , drafted and signed by members of the administrative council ( including the mayor ) of GPE , there was an armed clash in GPE on DATE and all property in the hamlet was burned . The document further states that the inhabitants of ORG were forced to leave the hamlet soon afterwards and flee to GPE .

CARDINAL . DATE , the applicants lived in the PERSON refugee camp , which had been established by the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees , in northern GPE . In DATE , following the closure of the camp by ORG , the applicants moved to ORG , a city in northern GPE . During the autumn of DATE they finally returned to GPE and began living in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , criminal proceedings were brought against CARDINAL people who had lived in the TIME refugee camp , including CARDINAL of the applicants , PERSON and ORG , who were charged with aiding and abetting members of the ORG ( ORG of Kurdistan , an illegal organisation ) while living in the camp .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the accused , finding that the charges against them were not proved beyond reasonable doubt .

CARDINAL . In DATE a member of parliament , PERSON , visited PERSON . Some of the applicants met PERSON PERSON and told him that in DATE one person had been killed , CARDINAL others had disappeared and CARDINAL of the applicants had suffered miscarriages following a military operation in their hamlet . Mr PERSON then requested ORG attached to ORG ( “ ORG ” ) to initiate an investigation into the ORG allegations . On DATE a newspaper published an article about Mr PERSON ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the chair of ORG , Dr PERSON , sent a letter to Mr PERSON informing him of the findings in the investigation conducted into the alleged events . She stated that in DATE a number of people from the ORG hamlet of GPE had become village guards . Some of them , including PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ( the relatives of the first , seventh , thirteenth and tenth applicants , respectively ) , had then made a deal with the ORG that it would not perpetrate acts of violence in the village in exchange for logistical support such as a DATE ’s salary from each village guard , food , shelter and ammunition . In DATE and DATE the village guards had helped members of the ORG to ambush security forces . In the first incident , CARDINAL members of the security forces had lost their lives and QUANTITY of them had been injured , and in the second incident CARDINAL members of the security forces had been killed . According to the report , as a result of pressure from the ORG the villagers moved to the ORG camp in northern GPE in DATE . Following the closure of the ORG camp by ORG , the villagers had returned to their homes in DATE . QUANTITY persons who had been involved in the illegal activities of the ORG had then surrendered to the authorities and CARDINAL of them had been put on trial after having been questioned . However , the residents of the Ormancık hamlet , particularly the women who had been questioned by the authorities on their return , had not mentioned anyone having been killed . Nor had they made any such allegations to the authorities . Consequently , it was considered that the allegations were unfounded .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after having read the above - mentioned newspaper article ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , the PERSON public prosecutor asked the PERSON public prosecutor to open an investigation into the allegations .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE , PERSON , PERSON , ORG , PERSON , PERSON , ORG , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON made statements before the PERSON public prosecutor , through interpreters , as they did not speak NORP . They all maintained that , following the security forces’ arrival at the hamlet , they had been forced to gather in the main square , whereupon the men of the village had been beaten . They stated that they did not know the reason why the security forces had come to the hamlet . They alleged that the security forces had illegally confiscated their belongings , such as money and jewellery , and had destroyed their houses . They further contended that a gendarmerie officer named PERSON had killed PERSON and that CARDINAL men had been taken away by soldiers . NORP , PERSON wife , maintained that they could not bury his husband as they had to leave the hamlet immediately after the killing and that she had been told that PERSON corpse had been buried where he had been killed by villagers from another hamlet . The applicants stated that the soldiers had taken CARDINAL other inhabitants of ORG into custody while driving to the military base . The applicants maintained that they had been told that their relatives had subsequently been killed and their corpses left in the vicinity of the military base . They further alleged that a lieutenant colonel known as “ PERSON ” had told the villagers that they were traitors and did not deserve to live in GPE , and that they should go to live in GPE , GPE or GPE . The inhabitants of the hamlet had then been coerced into leaving the hamlet and , subsequently , the country . They had been forced to go to GPE by members of the ORG . PERSON and PERSON further maintained that they had been pregnant at the time of the incident and that they had both suffered miscarriages as a result of having being beaten by the security forces . The applicants requested that those responsible for the killing of PERSON and the disappearance of the CARDINAL other villagers be found and punished .

CARDINAL . The PERSON public prosecutor also took statements from ORG , who had allegedly been the commanding officer of the soldiers who had gone to ORG , as well as from the non - commissioned gendarmerie officer , ORG They both denied the ORG allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the request of the PERSON public prosecutor , the military forces sent a letter to the public prosecutor ’s office stating that soldiers had arrested CARDINAL villagers and taken them to the GPE military base . The villagers had been released after questioning . However , Aşur Seçkin had died immediately afterwards as a result of gunshot wounds received from an unknown source while trying to escape to join the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor drew up a report ( fezleke ) in which he set out the developments in the investigation . In his report , the public prosecutor identified GPE and GPE as the “ accused ” and PERSON , PERSON , ORG , PERSON , PERSON , ORG , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON as the “ complainants ” . The offences allegedly committed by the accused were defined as homicide , aggravated theft ( gasp ) , the causing of a miscarriage , the forced evacuation of a village and the burning of vehicles . According to this report , on DATE , in the vicinity of the ORG hamlet , CARDINAL soldiers had been killed and QUANTITY soldiers wounded , in an ambush set up by members of the ORG with the aid of a group of village guards from the hamlet . Subsequently , a group of soldiers under the command of Lieutenant Colonel GPE and non - commissioned officer PERSON had arrived at the hamlet . The PERSON public prosecutor cited the allegations of the applicants who had made statements in DATE and DATE and the contents of the letter from the military forces dated DATE . The public prosecutor concluded that the ORG had jurisdiction to deal with cases involving offences allegedly committed by members of the security forces and referred the investigation file to the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office with a request to punish the accused for the offences cited in the report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor declined jurisdiction and sent the file to ORG for authorisation to investigate the actions of the members of the security forces , pursuant to ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( b ) of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL and ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided not to authorise the prosecution of GPE and GPE In its decision , ORG noted that the complainants had maintained that they had not known the accused . ORG further stated that the ORG account of events was hypothetical and that the accused officers had not been in ORG on DATE and furthermore that ORG had never been there .

CARDINAL . The decision of DATE was not served on the complainants . However , as decisions not to prosecute made by district councils were subject to an automatic appeal to regional administrative courts at the material time , the decision was then referred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision not to prosecute GPE and GPE This decision was not served on the complainants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appointed PERSON as their legal representative .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON applied to the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office for the case to be referred to ORG , and requested information concerning the outcome of the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor sent Mr PERSON a copy of the decisions of ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE he lodged the present application with the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON submitted to the ORG a letter dated DATE from the president of ORG , stating that review decisions of this type were not communicated to the parties . The president noted that such judgments were sent to the relevant domestic authorities , together with the investigation files .

CARDINAL . On DATE , Mr PERSON also submitted a document signed by members of ORG and CARDINAL witnesses , in which the latter declared that PERSON , PERSON and PERSON had been the partners of Aşur Seçkin , PERSON and PERSON , respectively , to whom they had been married according to NORP traditions .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice applicable at the material time can be found in the judgment of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINALII ) .
